unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate knowledge of ethical and legal issues relating to web applications
Use your knowledge of the underlying technologies of the web to communicate in detail how web applications work
Design and develop a data driven web application using modern web technologies.
Use automated and other tests to ensure that implementations match client and accessibility requirements.
Critique web design and apply good design principles to develop accessible web applications.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Review online video content, read lecture notes and related material.

assessments.description: This is a programming task. You will develop a web application that makes use of a data store. You will be provided with a set of tests that your code must pass as well as a set of functional requirements for the application.

Each week there will be a task set as part of the weekly workshop that you will need to complete. This may involve submission of some code, an online activity or a quiz.Â  Each week will be worth 1 mark up to a total of 10.

Each week there will be a task set during the practical workshop that you will need to complete. You will need to attend the workshop to complete this task and show your work to your tutor. Each week will be worth 1 mark up to a total of 10.

This is a design task using CSS. You will be asked to write a CSS stylesheet for a sample web page. The results will be peer-marked - you will be given the chance to see the work of other students and provide marks and feedback. The final mark will be based on marks given by your peers.
The final exam will asses your ability to describe and explain the technologies we have covered in the unit. It will cover all of the material in the unit.

You will write a report on the legal and ethical aspect of web design and development. This will involve you researching the topic to find sources of information and using them to develop your report. You will be provided with pointers to resources but will be expected to find more based on your own research.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit covers a range of techniques and concepts that are relevant to implementing systems on the world wide web. From web site development using HTML and CSS, through to complete client-server applications, the unit explores the full spectrum of this technology, providing insight into the standards underlying the web and the programming techniques used to exploit these standards to build web applications.
data.title: Web Technology

description: This unit covers a range of techniques and concepts that are relevant to implementing systems on the world wide web. title: Web Technology
